CatDescriptText: Miss Marva Sampson, 1902 Charles Street, a student at Irwin Avenue Vocational School, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1957, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that parents should be imprisoned for the unlawful acts of their children (under 18 years of age)?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so. Kids, 13 years of age and older, are responsible themselves for their actions.  At that age, I myself knew the difference between right and wrong."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marva Sampson wearing plaid scarf and dark coat, holding paper bag, standing on street in front of Amoco gas station
